item.title: Python Notes, Part 2 - Sequences
item.description: Python provides a variety of sequences; understanding these builtin sequences saves us from reinventing the wheel. We can also aspire to create APIs that support existing and user created sequence types. Python offers two types of sequences: Container sequences: These hold items of different types, for example list, tuple, etc. Flat sequences: These hold items of the same type, for example str, bytes, etc. A container sequence holds references to objects where as a flat sequence contains the value of the contents in it’s own memory.
